Family (1) Trademarks (1) Trivia (6) Edit Overview Overview Born July 29 , 1955 · Thouars, Deux-Sèvres, France Born Height 5′ 7½″ (1.71 m) Height Mini bio Mini bio Sensual, ambiguous, ultra sensitive French performer Jean-Hugues Anglade always had a reputation of intense and passionate actor. Any role, any language, Anglade seems to be able to do anything. From appearing integrally naked alongside Beatrice Dalle in "37.2 degrees in the morning", to playing an homosexual role in "The wounded man", from portraying the king of France in "Queen Margot", to playing a Canadian cop alongside Angelina Jolie and Ethan Hawke in "Taking lives", from playing Anne Parillaud's lover in "Nikita", to showing the 40-years-old-men crisis. Now Anglade is an established actor, a respected artist and man, who overcame the drama of his childhood. - IMDb mini biography by: shy Family Family Spouse Pamela Soo (1996 - 2000) (divorced) Spouse (1996 - 2000) (divorced) Trademarks Trademarks Frequently cast in Luc Besson's films. Trivia Trivia Aug 21, 2015, Injured his hand in a terrorist attack on a train from Amsterdam to Paris, with his 2 children and family. Rescued by 3 Americans (Spencer Stone, Anthony Sadler, & Alek Skarlatos), along with British citizen Chris Norman. Sadler was hospitalized. Mentioned in song "Cosmopolitan" by Vincent Delerm. Spent 5 years in the "Conservatoire d'art dramatique" in Paris. Father is a veterinary.
